# geocn <img src="man/figures/logo.png" align="right" height="90"/>

<!-- badges: start -->

[![CRAN](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/geocn)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=geocn)
[![r-universe](https://spatlyu.r-universe.dev/badges/geocn)](https://spatlyu.r-universe.dev/geocn)

<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of geocn is to provide various commonly used spatial data related to Chinese regions in the R programming environment.

## Installation

### Install from source

You can install the development version of *geocn* from [*github*](https://github.com/SpatLyu/geocn):

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("SpatLyu/geocn",
                         build_vignettes = T,
                         dep = T)
```

### Install the binary version

You can also install the binary version of **geocn** from [r-universe](https://spatlyu.r-universe.dev/geocn):

``` r
install.packages("geocn", 
                 repos = c("https://spatlyu.r-universe.dev",
                           "https://cran.rstudio.com/"),
                 dep = TRUE)
```

## Example

### Drawing a Map of China Using `ggplot2`and `ggspatial`

```{r map1,fig.width=9.5,fig.height=3.5}
library(sf)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggspatial)
library(cowplot)
```

### Drawing a Map of China Using `tmap`

```{r map2,fig.width=7.25,fig.height=6}
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(cowplot)
```
